textos_fuente.text: Community Foundation of Broward | Board and Staff X Attention Internet Explorer Users: To enjoy the full experience, more speed and security, please use or download one of these free, up-to-date browsers below: Microsoft Edge Â Â Â |Â Â Â Mozilla Firefox Â Â Â |Â Â Â Google Chrome Â Â Â |Â Â Â Opera Software Log In Fundholders Nonprofits Board Members Donate Now About Us What We Do Board & Staff Mission, Vision & Values Community Leadership & Impact Financial Information Careers Building Community and Opportunity Give Prospective Donors Fundholders Advisors Receive Apply for Grants Apply for Scholarships Training, Support & Resources Learn Center for Nonprofit Excellence Impact Stories Events FAQs Publications News Videos Contact Us Board and Staff The Community Foundation of Browardâs experienced leadership team is committed to creating a community that is a vibrant place where everyone can thrive, feel connected and have the opportunity to reach their full potential. Board of Directors Our dynamic Board of Directors includes innovative executives and dedicated community leaders who guide our leadership and grantmaking, driving us to create BOLD impact. Mona Pittenger Chair Mona is an activist and philanthropist who calls Fort Lauderdale home. In 2011, she retired as owner of a real estate company specializing in the management and sale of government foreclosures. She was a founding Board Member of Our Fund Foundation, an LGBT foundation in Fort Lauderdale. Originally from Oklahoma, Mona co-founded the Tulsa Girls Art School, a nonprofit serving underprivileged girls. She previously served as a member of the Board of Trustees for Phillips Theological Seminary in Tulsa as well as the national boards of Lambda Legal, Victory Fund and Freedom for All Americans. Mona Pittenger Mona is an activist and philanthropist who calls Fort Lauderdale home. Read more Jonathan K. Allen Vice Chair Jonathan serves as Director of Broward Countyâs Water and Wastewater Services Business Operations Division. He earned a bachelorâs degree in economics from Florida A&M University and a masterâs degree in public administration from the University of Kansas. He has held past positions as City Manager, Assistant City Manager, Public Works Director and other roles for five local governments in Kansas and Florida. He is an active member of the New Mount Olive Baptist Church, Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity Inc., National Forum for Black Public Administrators and other civic/professional organizations. Jonathan K. Read more Burnadette Norris-Weeks Secretary Burnadette is a partner in Austin Pamies Norris Weeks Powell, PLLC. She serves a counsel to various governmental entities, including cities in Broward, Miami-Dade and Palm Beach counties. She is a Past Chair for the Greater Fort Lauderdale Chamber of Commerce and is a member of the Board Directors for Habitat for Humanity of Broward. Burnadette is founder of the Women of Color Empowerment Institute, Inc. and also serves as a member of the Federal Judicial Nominating Conference for the Southern District of Florida. Burnadette Norris-Weeks Burnadette is a partner in Austin Pamies Norris Weeks Powell, PLLC. She serves a counsel to various governmental entities, including cities in Broward, Miami-Dade and Palm Beach counties. She is a Past Chair for the Greater Fort Lauderdale Chamber of Commerce and is a member of the Board Directors for Habitat for Humanity of Broward. Burnadette is founder of the Women of Color Empowerment Institute, Inc. and also serves as a member of the Federal Judicial Nominating Conference for the Southern District of Florida. Read more Bertha Henry Treasurer Bertha has a longstanding career in public service, with more than 30 years of experience in public administration. In 2022, she retired as Broward County Administrator. As the countyâs top executive officer, she managed a nearly $6 billion budget and directed more than 7,000 employees from more than 60 county agencies. She began working for Broward County in 1996, serving as assistant to the county administrator. She later became Miamiâs assistant city manager of finance administration. In 2000, she returned to Broward County to serve as deputy county administrator for eight years prior to her appointment as county administrator. In 2017, she was honored with the International City/County Management Association Career Excellence Award. Bertha has a bachelorâs degree in Government and a masterâs degree in Public Administration and from Florida State University. Read more Ramona Lacy Fowler At-Large Ramona is an Executive Advisor to health care organizations. She has consulted with hundreds of hospitals, health systems and academic medical centers as well as GPOs, technology companies, physician practice companies and health plans. She was co-founder and Managing Partner of Prism Healthcare Partners, a health care consulting firm. Prior to that, she was a Principal for Wellspring Partners, the third-largest healthcare consulting company firm. She served on the Board of two health care consulting firms, Prism Healthcare Partners and Wellspring Partners, and she serves on the Community Foundation of Browardâs Investment Committee. Read more Eric J. Vainder At-Large Eric is Northern Trustâs Senior Market Executive for Broward County. Since joining Northern Trust in 1998, he has closely advised high-net-worth families, individuals and foundations in all areas of wealth management. Prior to his current role, he served as Senior Managing Director of a Private Client Advisory Team based in Miami. Eric's community involvement includes serving as Chairman of the Board of Easter Seals of South Florida; Board Member of the Overtown Youth Center; Chairman of the United Way's Professional Advisors Committee in Miami-Dade; Advisory Board Member for Philanthropy Miami; and Member of the Nationwide Gift Planning Advisor Council for the American Cancer Society. Read more Holly Hudson Bodenweber Holly is president of the Hudson Family Foundation who is serving her second stint on the Community Foundation Board. Hollyâs other local leadership roles include board positions for the NSU Art Museum, Funding Arts Broward, Broward Library Foundation and Pine Crest School. In addition, she is actively involved in numerous community organizations, including the Broward Center for the Performing Arts, Young at Art, Broward Health, Humane Society of Broward, Joe DiMaggioâs Childrenâs Hospital, JDRF, Diabetes Research Institute, American Heart Association, Boys and Girls Clubs of Broward, the Jack and Jill Center, Take Stock in Children, Heart Gallery of Broward County, Habitat for Humanity and YMCA. A Broward County native, Holly attended Pine Crest School in Fort Lauderdale. She graduated from Southern Methodist University in Dallas, Texas with a bachelorâs degree in Art History. Read more Ted Christie Ted is former president and CEO of Spirit Airlines. He joined the airline in 2012, previously serving as its President, Senior Vice President and CFO. Prior to joining Spirit, he served as CFO of Pinnacle Airlines Corp, an airline holding company with subsidiaries flying as Delta Connection, United Express and US Airways Express. Ted began his airline career at Frontier Airlines in 2002. He was also Vice President of Finance at a Denver asset-based finance institution and served as an Economist for the Arizona taxing authority. Ted earned a Bachelor of Business Administration in Finance from the University of Arizona. Ted Christie Ted is former president and CEO of Spirit Airlines. He joined the airline in 2012, previously serving as its President, Senior Vice President and CFO. Prior to joining Spirit, he served as CFO of Pinnacle Airlines Corp, an airline holding company with subsidiaries flying as Delta Connection, United Express and US Airways Express. Ted began his airline career at Frontier Airlines in 2002. He was also Vice President of Finance at a Denver asset-based finance institution and served as an Economist for the Arizona taxing authority. Ted earned a Bachelor of Business Administration in Finance from the University of Arizona. Read more Marianela âNelaâ Collado Marianela is a senior wealth advisor and is CEO and co-owner of Tobias Financial Advisors in Plantation, Florida. She also serves as Chair of the Professional Advisors Council at the Community Foundation of Broward. She is passionate about giving back and being involved in her community and has earned recognition such as Mother of the Year by Healthy Mothers, Healthy Babies (2021). In addition, she is a Board member of Nova Southeastern Universityâs Planned Giving Council, Planned Giving Council of Broward, Gildaâs Club South Florida, and a member of many more organizations. Read more Aurelio Fernandez Aurelio, a health care professional for more than 45 years, is former President and CEO for Memorial Healthcare System. Previously, he spent 11 years in a variety of positions with Tenet Healthcare, including CEO at Hialeah Hospital and Florida Medical Center and Executive Director for Tenet Network Management. Aurelio is active in many organizations and has served in leadership roles for Catholic Health Services, the Florida Hospital Association, the Safety Net Hospital Alliance of Florida, Broward Workshop and the South Florida Hospital Healthcare Association. He was appointed to serve on the Transition Advisory Committee for Health and Wellness for Governor Ron DeSantis in 2018. He was born in Havana, Cuba and has lived in South Florida for 60 years. He earned a bachelorâs degree in Business Administration and a masterâs degree in Health Services Administration from Florida International University. Read more Trevor Fried Trevor is a financial advisor, published author and senior portfolio management director/founder of The Las Olas Group at Morgan Stanley. He serves as a member of the Investment Committee of the Community Foundation of Broward. Fried is also a Community Foundation of Broward Community Builder, a group of local philanthropists who create endowed charitable funds of $1 million or more to shape a brighter future for Broward. He is an active member or Board member of several civic and benevolent organizations in Broward County. Since 2013, he has been a member of the Planned Giving Council of Broward. He recently served as the Board Chair at Gildaâs Club of South Florida and continues serving as an honorary Board member. In addition, he is a volunteer Guardian for Honor Flight South Florida. In 2019, he was appointed as a trustee of the South Florida National Parks Trust. Horvitz David is the Chairman of the Board and CEO of South Ocean Capital Partners, and previously Chairman of WLD Enterprises. He is a board member of United States Artists and a founder and former chair of the board of Camp Boggy Creek. David is also on the board of The Lewis Prize, a grantmaking organization in the arts focused on music education. He is the past Chair of the Board of Governors of the NSU Art Museum Ft. Lauderdale and was a Trustee of the Kresge Foundation. He is a graduate of Kenyon College and has a J.D. from the University of Florida. David W. Read more Susanne Cornfeld Hurowitz Susanne is President of HB Capital Group, a privately held, real estate investment and management company. She was formerly President of SCH Consulting, which advised nonprofit organizations on strategic planning initiatives. Prior to that, she was Director of Development for Homes for the Homeless in New York and has remained on the board for the past 15 years. Susanne serves on the board of the Joe DiMaggio Childrenâs Hospital Foundation/Memorial Hospital Foundation. She is a member of the Weill Cornell Medicine Deanâs Council, Dyson Advisory Council at Cornell University, Advisory Board for Columbia Business Schoolâs Tamer Center for Social Enterprise, University of Miami Department of Neurology Advisory Board and the Institute for Children and Poverty Board of Directors. Susanne holds a bachelorâs degree from Tufts University and an MBA from Columbia University. Read more Dara Levan Dara is a writer, podcaster and founder of Every Soul Has a Story. What Dara began as a blog has expanded to include a podcast in which she interviews inspiring guests from around the globe. She is a board member for Joe DiMaggio Childrenâs Hospital Foundation/Memorial Hospital Foundation and a former board member for Goodman Jewish Family Services of Broward County, Junior Achievement of South Florida, and I Care I Cure Childhood Cancer Foundation. Dara is a founding member of the Circle of Friends for the Alvin Sherman Library Research, Information, and Technology Center at Nova Southeastern University and a graduate of Leadership Broward. Dara has a bachelorâs degree in English and minor in journalism from Indiana University. She earned her masterâs degree in Communication Sciences and Disorders from Nova Southeastern University. Read more Sigrid S. McCawley Sigrid is a Managing Partner of Boies Schiller Flexner, where she helps oversee nearly 200 attorneys in the U.S. and London. She has more than 20 years of experience litigating some of the most sophisticated commercial litigation disputes in the country and abroad. Sigrid has been a leader in the legal fight on behalf of victims in high-profile sex trafficking cases, including the Jeffrey Epstein case. She was named Litigator of the Year by The American Lawyer and Top Ten Female Litigator in 2020, 2021 and 2022 by Benchmark Litigation. Her community involvement includes serving on ChildNetâs Board of Directors as well as the Jack & Jill Centerâs Board of Directors. Sigrid S. Before joining the CFB she served as Vice President of Advancement and Community Relations at Nova Southeastern University (NSU). Membership opportunities are offered through the Broward Center for the Performing Arts. To view all of our membership options, click here .
